translation.en: One hundred, oh, my goodness. Right at the buzzer.
Good.
--the few exceptions is the African pancake tortoise...
...which has a flat, flexible shell that allows it to hide in rock crevasses--

translation.en: --big swath of light to moderate snow from the Broken Bow area...

...we created this fall in our fields.

translation.en: Don't let false allegations bully you into an unfair fight.

It's just a start, there'll be more. Unless you're gonna just tear them all up.
translation.ko: 첫 수표이고 또 줄 거야 그것도 다 찢을 거라면 아니지만

translation.en: And why was it made out to me? Why not Chuck?
translation.ko: 왜 내 이름으로 보냈지? 척이 아니고?

translation.en: Can he make his way to the bank?
I just assumed it was best to have the money go through you.
translation.ko: 그냥 자네를 통해서 돈을 전하는 게 최선이라고 생각했네

translation.en: We can do it any way you want.
This isn't going away, Howard.
translation.ko: 이런다고 없던 일이 되지 않아, 하워드

translation.en: What Chuck did for this firm, and damn near single-handedly...
translation.ko: 척이 이 회사를 위해 거의 혼자서 해낸 일은...

translation.en: ...one-third of this place belongs to him. Yeah.
What have you got, 12 chairs here? Four of these chairs are Chuck's.
You got five of these light thingamajigs...
translation.ko: 여기 불 들어오는 거 다섯 개 있는데

translation.en: ...one and two-thirds are Chuck's. Yeah.
How many Danishes? Six Danishes?
translation.ko: 대니시 빵은 몇 개지? 여섯 개?

translation.en: -You can have all the Danish you want. -No, no. They're Chuck's Danishes.
translation.ko: - 빵은 얼마든지 먹게 - 아니, 척의 빵이지

translation.en: And Chuck isn't greedy, so he'll just take two...
translation.ko: 척은 욕심이 없으니까 두 개만 먹고

translation.en: ...plus $17 million. In that ballpark.
I mean, we'll know once we get the accountants poking around here.
translation.ko: 회계사들을 시켜서 조사해보면 확실한 액수를 알겠지

translation.en: Until then, no more penny ante checks designed to make it look...
translation.ko: 그때까진 척 형이 아직도 여기서 일하는 것처럼 보이게 하는

translation.en: ...like Chuck still works here. He doesn't. He never will again.
translation.ko: 이런 푼돈 수표는 보내지 마 일하지 않으니까, 다신 안 해

translation.en: It's time to do right by him, and cash him out.
translation.ko: 제대로 대접해주고 정당한 돈을 지불할 때라고

translation.en: So these are Chuck's own wishes that you're conveying?
translation.ko: 척 자신이 원하는 사항을 전달하는 건가?

translation.en: This is what's best for him.
So he personally told you that it's his wish to withdraw from the firm?
translation.ko: 척이 자네에게 직접 회사를 그만두기 원한다고 했다고?

translation.en: See, that would surprise me.
It's been nearly a year since he set foot in here.
translation.ko: 형이 여기 발을 들여놨던 게 거의 1년 전이야

translation.en: -I'm just doing what's in his best interests. -So am I.
translation.ko: - 형에게 최선인 일을 하는 거야 - 나도야

translation.en: And I, for one, believe he's gonna lick this thing.
translation.ko: 그런데 난 척이 나아서 올 거라고 생각하지

translation.en: Until then, his office is just as he left it. His secretary is still on payroll.
translation.ko: 그때까진 사무실도 그대로 놔뒀고 척의 비서도 월급 받고 있어

translation.en: If Chuck can call this an extended sabbatical, then so can we.
translation.ko: 척이 이걸 연장 휴식기로 생각한다면 우리도 그럴 수 있어

translation.en: He's that important to us.
You know what? Let's let a jury figure it out.
Yeah. They're gonna love you, Howard.
You're so down to earth and relatable.
And you will atone.
It's Ned Beatty from Network.
For chrissakes, guys.
Jimmy.
I almost forgot. This month's filings.
You can save me the postage.
Weren't you listening in there? Chuck doesn't work here anymore.
translation.ko: 내 말 못 들었어? 척은 이제 여기서 일 안 한다고

translation.en: Think I'm gonna help you establish a paper trail?
-Jimmy-- -Stop trying to pawn that shit off on him.
translation.ko: - 지미... - 형한테 그딴 거 넘기려 하지 마

translation.en: Jimmy.
You know, Jimmy, sometimes in our line of work...
...you can get so caught up in the idea of winning...
...that you forget to listen to your heart.
translation.ko: 마음에 귀를 기울이는 걸 잊곤 하지

translation.en: Give Chuck my love, would you?
Oh, there you are. Betsy, Craig.
Hi. Oh, Craig, you need your own purse.
-Did it work out? -Yeah.
It was very nice.
-You look lovely today. -Oh, thank you so much.
-Couldn't you just--? -You know I can't.
translation.ko: - 그냥 좀... - 안 된다는 거 알잖아

translation.en: Son of a bitch.
-You ground yourself? -Yes, I grounded myself.
You gotta stop putting bacon on the list.
translation.ko: 살 물건 목록에 베이컨 좀 쓰지 마

translation.en: That cooler's looking like a trichinosis stew.
Perfect timing.
Professor Brans Vogelson?
University of Helsinki?
Yeah, you're gonna have to get that translated.
-Into Swedish? -Finnish.
Finish translating into--?
I'm sure there's someone at UNM who can do that.
translation.ko: 뉴멕시코 대학에 할 수 있는 사람이 있을 거야

translation.en: You do know I'm trying to start a legal practice?
translation.ko: 내가 법률 사무소 시작하려고 하는 건 알지?

translation.en: Vogelson's been working on the effects of electromagnetic fields on zebrafish and--
translation.ko: 보겔슨은 전자기장이 제브라피시에 끼치는 영향을 연구했는데...

translation.en: Financial Times.
Yeah, I knew you missed it, so I figured, what the heck?
Thank you. I know it's expensive here.
-That's not-- -I don't expect you to go out-of-pocket.
translation.ko: - 됐어... - 네가 손해 보면 안 되지

translation.en: Go ahead, reimburse yourself.
Thanks.
Hey, Chuck, can you not read that for a second?
translation.ko: 형, 그거 잠깐만 안 읽으면 안 돼?

translation.en: Can we talk?
Are you all right? You look peaked.
I'm fine. Please, just sit.
You're not in trouble?
You gotta cash out.
-You gotta. -Again? Really?
translation.ko: - 그래야 해 - 또 그 얘기야? 진짜로?

translation.en: There's no other way.
I know that you don't wanna hear it, but you've got to.
translation.ko: 듣고 싶지 않다는 거 알지만 그렇게 해야 해

translation.en: You know I'm going to beat this.
You know I'm going to get better.
Yeah, sure.
Well, then there's nothing more to talk about.
I will beat this. Ergo, a falsis principiis proficisci.
translation.ko: 난 나을 거야, 그러므로 '원리에서 거짓을 분리하라'

translation.en: -Meaning.... -That's not--
-Meaning.... -That's the one about false principles--
You proceed from false principles.
Your argument is built on quicksand, therefore it collapses.
translation.ko: 네 주장은 모래늪을 토대로 했기 때문에 무너지지

translation.en: Yeah, you're not listening.
Fine. Let's take this to its logical conclusion.
In order to pay out my share...
...suppose my partners are forced to liquidate the firm.
translation.ko: 파트너들이 회사를 청산해야 한다고 생각해 봐

translation.en: -Then what? -That's their problem.
My clients are out in the cold.
My cases are scattered to the winds, 126 people lose their jobs.
translation.ko: 내 사건들은 다 뿔뿔이 흩어지고 126명이 실직하게 돼

translation.en: What happens to your cronies in the mailroom?
The assistants, paralegals, the janitorial staff...
...all of them out on the street.
Your friend Kim, a promising career, over and done with.
translation.ko: 네 친구 킴의 촉망받던 장래도 끝나는 거야

translation.en: Hamlin owes you everything. You built that place singlehandedly...
translation.ko: 햄린은 형에게 모든 걸 빚졌어 형이 혼자 세운 곳이라고

translation.en: ...while he was at Four Hills working on his bunker shot.
translation.ko: 그 자식이 골프나 치러 다닐 동안

translation.en: -Let's not exaggerate. I helped. -You helped.
translation.ko: - 과장하지 마, 난 도운 것뿐이야 - 도왔다니

translation.en: All the more reason not to tear it down just for a little bit of cash.
translation.ko: 그러니까 더욱 푼돈 좀 받자고 박살내면 안 되는 거야

translation.en: Chuck, I'm going under. Okay?
For the third time, with these bull-crap contract counsel--
translation.ko: 벌써 세 번째지만 이런 헛소리 계약 변호는...

translation.en: -Bull crap? -Bull crap, pissant, PD cases...
...at 700 bucks a shot.
Public defender work is some of the best experience there is.
translation.ko: 국선 변호는 최고의 경험 중 하나야

translation.en: I just had a case, Chuck, with three clients.
translation.ko: 방금 의뢰인이 세 명인 재판을 맡았어

translation.en: Arraignment, voir dire, jury trial, the whole nine yards.
translation.ko: 공소, 예비 심문, 배심 재판 전부 다 했어

translation.en: You know what I took home? Seven hundred bucks.
I might as well head down to skid row and sell plasma.
translation.ko: 차라리 빈민굴에 가서 혈장을 팔고 말지

translation.en: You're representing people who have nowhere else to turn.
translation.ko: 넌 갈 곳 없는 사람들을 대변해주는 거야

translation.en: Money is beside the point.
Money is not beside the point. Money is the point.
translation.ko: 돈이 왜 요점이 아니야 돈이 바로 요점이야

translation.en: I keep telling you, have patience. There are no shortcuts.
translation.ko: 내가 인내심을 가지라고 했지? 지름길은 없어

translation.en: -Do good work and the clients-- -The clients will come. Yeah, I know.
translation.ko: - 일을 잘하면 의뢰인은... - 의뢰인은 저절로 온다, 알아

translation.en: Okay.
Hand to God, I wasn't gonna say this, but you are broke.
translation.ko: 이 말은 정말 안 하려고 했는데 형은 빈털터리야

translation.en: I can't carry both of us. I've been trying like hell, but I can't.
translation.ko: 내가 우리 둘 다 책임질 순 없어 죽어라 노력했지만 안 된다고

translation.en: You're saying, what, you think you have to provide for me?
translation.ko: 뭐야, 네가 날 먹여 살려야 한다고 생각하는 거야?

translation.en: -I never asked you that. -You didn't have to ask, okay?
translation.ko: - 난 그런 부탁한 적 없어 - 부탁할 필요도 없었어

translation.en: I've been doing my damnedest, but the day of reckoning is here.
translation.ko: 정말 최선을 다했지만 이제 직시할 때가 왔다고

translation.en: Soon, Chuck, you're gonna be out on the street...
translation.ko: 형은 곧 길에 나앉게 될 거야

translation.en: ...with all the electromagnetism in the world raining down on you.
translation.ko: 세상의 모든 전자기파가 형에게 쏟아질 거라고

translation.en: Now, please, please, picture that...
...then tell me that money is beside the point.
-This is what has you all worked up? -Yeah.
Jimmy, there's nothing to worry about.
-Here. -What is this?
A stipend. There's gonna be one every week.
translation.ko: 급료야 매주 한 장씩 올 거야

translation.en: Eight hundred and fifty seven dollars from Hamlin Hamlin McGill.
I'm gonna pay him back. Every penny.
I didn't wanna take anything, but Howard was very insistent.
translation.ko: 아무것도 안 받으려고 했는데 하워드가 고집했어

translation.en: And I'm gonna pay you back too.
-Hamlin was here? -It's not like I'm a recluse.
translation.ko: - 햄린이 왔었어? - 내가 은둔하는 것도 아니잖아

translation.en: -He put his cell phone in the mailbox? -He understands the situation.
translation.ko: - 휴대폰을 우편함에 넣었어? - 햄린도 상황을 이해해

translation.en: -He grounded himself? -Of course.
And the two of you agreed that since, as everybody knows...
...you're going back to work any day now, the firm should help you make ends meet?
translation.ko: 형은 이제 곧 복귀할 테니 회사가 먹고 살게 도와줘야 한다고?

translation.en: That's correct, minus the sarcasm.
Hamlin's making you a chump.
I'm going to get better.
I'm gonna go back to work, and I'm picking up where I left off.
translation.ko: 직장에도 복귀하고 중단했던 곳에서부터 시작할 거라고

translation.en: Sorry.
Sorry, Chuck.
I understand that you're trying to look out for me...
translation.ko: 네가 날 생각해서 그러는 건 알지만

translation.en: ...but you're missing the bigger picture.
translation.ko: 넌 더 큰 그림을 못 보고 있어

translation.en: I got it.
Speaking of which....
Howard brought this.
-He's concerned. -What?
You have to admit, it could be confusing. Hamlin Hamlin McGill. James M. McGill.
translation.ko: 솔직히 좀 헷갈릴 수 있잖아 햄린 햄린 맥길, 제임스 M. 맥길

translation.en: -That's my name, I was born with it. I-- -Still.
How about "Vanguard Law"?
Or "Gibraltar." Ple--
Wait, so I'm not supposed to use my name on Hamlin's say-so?
translation.ko: 잠깐, 햄린이 말했다고 내 이름을 쓰지 말란 거야?

translation.en: What's he gonna do, sue me?
Nobody wants to create an adversarial situation.
I'm sure Howard would gladly pay the cost of new matchbooks and so on.
translation.ko: 새 성냥갑 인쇄 비용 정도는 하워드가 기꺼이 내줄 거야

translation.en: It's simply a matter of professional courtesy.
Chuck, whose side are you on?
There are no sides.
But Jimmy....
Wouldn't you rather build your own identity?
Why ride on someone else's coattails?
translation.ko: 왜 남의 명성 덕을 보려고 해?

translation.en: You wanna dance, Howard?
Let's dance.
Yeah, backside on it.
Go.
You can get closer than that, you bitch. Come on.
translation.ko: 더 가까이 올 수 있잖아 계집애 같긴, 어서

translation.en: All right, here it comes.
There you go. Better.
-How was that? -It's all right. Here, take a look.
-So tighter. Everything-- -Tighter? What--? Tighter what?
translation.ko: - 좀 더 바짝 해 - 바짝? 뭘 더 바짝 해?

translation.en: I don't know, just stand tighter. You know what I mean?
translation.ko: 몰라, 좀 바짝 서라고 내 말뜻 알지?

translation.en: I don't know what you mean.
That's a-- We can call that a stylistic choice, I guess.
Hey, fellas. We got business.
How did you find us?
I know. Eerie, right?
Whoa, come on. Give me 30 seconds.
Could be the most profitable 30 seconds of your lives.
translation.ko: 너희들 일생에 가장 이득이 되는 30초일 수도 있어

translation.en: Let me tell you about a young guy.
Actually, he's about your age.
He lived a long way from here...
...in a town called Cicero, Illinois.
And in Cicero, he was the man.
translation.ko: 그 친구는 시서로에서 아주 잘 나갔어

translation.en: I mean, when he strolled down the street...
...all the corner boys would give him the high five.
translation.ko: 모퉁이에 서 있던 남자들이 하이파이브를 했지

translation.en: All the finest babes would smile at him...
translation.ko: 제일 예쁜 여자들이 그 친구를 보고 웃고

translation.en: ...and hope that he would smile back.
They called him Slippin' Jimmy...
...and everybody wanted to be his friend.
Slippin' Jimmy.
What the hell kind of name is that?
Well, I'll tell you now. Winters in Cicero are murder.
translation.ko: 지금 말해주지 시서로의 겨울은 죽을 만큼 추워

translation.en: You guys, growing up out here in the Golden West, you don't know.
Okay? I'm talking cold that'll freeze the snot right in your nose.
translation.ko: 알았냐? 콧속의 콧물까지 얼 정도의 추위라고

translation.en: I'm talking wind that'll cut through your jacket and carve you up like a Ginsu knife.
translation.ko: 재킷을 뚫고 들어와 살을 벨 정도의 칼바람이란 말이야

translation.en: In fact, most folks in Cicero were scared of winter.
But not Jimmy.
Jimmy would wait around all summer...
...and when September finally rolled around...
...and he'd feel that first cold wind come sweeping off Lake Michigan...
translation.ko: 미시건 호수에서 불어오는 첫 찬바람이 느껴지면

translation.en: ...he knew it was coming.
Was it Christmas? Was it Kwanzaa?
Better. It was slip-and-fall season.
translation.ko: 더 좋은 거야 미끄러져 넘어지는 계절이었지

translation.en: As soon as it was cold enough, he'd find a nice, smooth patch of ice.
translation.ko: 날씨가 충분히 추워지면 지미는 좋은 빙판을 찾아내곤 했어

translation.en: State Street was good, Michigan Avenue was better.
translation.ko: 스테이트 가는 좋았어 미시건 애비뉴가 더 나았지

translation.en: He'd pick his spot, wait for it to get busy...
...then he'd walk out on the ice and boom.
He would biff it so hard...
...people would come running from five blocks away.
translation.ko: 다섯 블록 떨어져 있던 사람들이 달려왔지

translation.en: Yeah, but did he collect?
"Did he collect?" Slippin' Jimmy had it dialed in.
One good fall, he'd clear 6, 8 grand.
That'd keep him in Old Milwaukee and Maui Waui right through Labor Day.
-Eight grand? -Eight grand.
Now, see, I look at you guys, I see potential.
The skateboard's a nice wrinkle, that makes it a year-round gig.
translation.ko: 스케이트보드는 괜찮은 요소야 일년 내내 할 수 있으니까

translation.en: Clearly, you know how to take a header. Right?
But I gotta ask you...
...your best day ever, how much did you clear?
translation.ko: 제일 실적 좋았던 날엔 얼마 벌었어?

translation.en: -Six hundred and thirty. -Six hundred and thirty.
Six hundred and thirty bucks? Was that for one fall?
-Two. -Two falls in one day?
translation.ko: - 두 번요 - 하루에 두 번 넘어졌어?

translation.en: -Even at your age, that's gotta hurt. -True that.
translation.ko: - 너희 나이라도 그건 아프겠다 - 진짜 그래요

translation.en: All right. Well, I got a job for you.
translation.ko: 좋아, 내가 너희들한테 시킬 일이 있어

translation.en: How's 2 grand sound?
Two grand for one hit?
One hit.
Plus you get to learn from the best.
-Nice boat. -Yeah.
Discrete, like a stripper pole in a mosque.
translation.ko: 튀지, 회교 사원 안의 스트립 댄스 봉 같아

translation.en: Forget the boat. Look at the car. You know what that is?
translation.ko: 보트 말고 차를 봐 저게 뭔지 알아?

translation.en: -I don't know, a station wagon? -It's a Mercury.
A 1988 Mercury Sable wagon.
Remember it. Burn it into your brains, you got it?
It's a Mercury Sable wagon, sure.
Close your eyes. What color is it?
-Brown. -Brown.
No, it's medium sandalwood.
Keep your eyes closed. How does the license plate start?
translation.ko: 눈 계속 감아 번호판이 어떻게 시작되지?

translation.en: -Four. -Give those gentlemen a gold star.
Betsy Kettleman's her name.
Every weekday between 2:25 and 2:50 she comes through here...
...on her way to pick up her kids at Kit Carson Elementary.
translation.ko: 아이들을 데리러 킷 카슨 초등학교에 가

translation.en: You need a place where she's gonna slow down, right?
-Yeah. -All right. Well, there you go.
She slows down, she hangs a right...
...you come shooting out of there and do what you did to me.
translation.ko: 너희는 저기서 튀어나와서 나한테 한 것처럼 해

translation.en: You go ass over teakettle, you make it a blue-ribbon special.
When she gets out of the car, you're suffering Saint Sebastian, right?
translation.ko: 벳시가 차에서 내리면 아파 죽겠다고 난리를 쳐

translation.en: You're the hammer. You get in her face, you scare the bejeezus out of her.
translation.ko: 넌 망치야, 얼굴을 맞대고 혼이 빠지게 겁을 주라고

translation.en: Give me your phone.
-It's kind of busy here, don't you think? -Yeah. Witnesses are good.
translation.ko: - 사람이 좀 많은 거 아니에요? - 그래, 목격자가 있으면 좋아

translation.en: Witnesses are pressure, all right?
Now, once you've got her good and rattled...
...then you call for an ambulance, but really you're calling for me.
I'm number one on your speed dial, next to your weed dealer.
translation.ko: 난 단축키 1번이야 대마초 장사 번호 다음

translation.en: You call me, I hotfoot it over here. I just "happened" to be driving by.
translation.ko: 전화하면 내가 우연히 지나가던 척하고 올게

translation.en: I stop to see what the trouble is, and this is the important part...
translation.ko: 뭐가 문제인지 보려고 선 거야 그리고 이게 중요한데

translation.en: ...you don't know me. We've never met. You got it?
translation.ko: 너희는 날 몰라 처음 만난 거라고, 알았어?

translation.en: -Sure. -Okay.
Now, I'm Mrs. K's white knight. We go mano a mano.
translation.ko: 난 케틀먼 부인의 백마 탄 기사야 너희와 다투지

translation.en: You light into me, okay? Get nasty.
translation.ko: 나한테 막 덤벼, 알았지? 험하게 굴라고

translation.en: No touching, leave the hair alone...
...but otherwise, you know, open season.
Yell, stomp, call me a douche bag.
translation.ko: 소리 지르고, 발 구르고 날 욕하고

translation.en: I'm gonna play it cool, give you back some of the razzmatazz...
...and once she's seen the fireworks, you fold like a lawn chair. Happy ending.
translation.ko: 부인이 내 실력을 보고 나면 접고 들어가라고, 해피 엔딩이야

translation.en: -When do we get our money? -After.
-"After." -After.
You get paid when I get paid. I'm the rising tide that raises all dinghies.
translation.ko: 내가 돈을 받아야 너희가 받지 난 모든 사고를 수습하는 존재라고

translation.en: Now, pop quiz. What's the car?
-Mercury Sable wagon. -Baby-poop brown.
translation.ko: - 머큐리 세이블 왜건 - 아기 똥 같은 갈색

translation.en: -Okay, do you know me? -No.
Damn straight. Go with God.
Well, I'm just glad I happened to be passing by.
Happy to be of help, Betsy. May I call you Betsy?
translation.ko: 도와드릴 수 있어 기쁩니다, 벳시 벳시라고 불러도 돼요?

translation.en: Please, call me James.
Oh, the kid will be fine. Don't worry.
translation.ko: 이 녀석은 괜찮을 겁니다 걱정 마세요

translation.en: He just got his bell rung a little. I'll handle that.
Oh, no.
Oh, no, no. I wouldn't think of taking your money for this, so....
translation.ko: 이런 일로 돈을 받을 순 없죠 그러니까...

translation.en: The embezzlement case? Yes, I'd be happy to talk it over.
translation.ko: 횡령 건 말인가요? 네, 물론 의논할 수 있죠

translation.en: Oh, shit.
Two-minute warning. Two-minute warning.
Got it.
Oh, my God.
What happened?
Call 911.
Oh, my God. Cal. Cal.
Look at me. Are you okay? Buddy, say something.
translation.ko: 날 봐, 괜찮아? 뭐라고 말 좀 해

translation.en: Cal, look at me. Come on already.
What is she doing in there? She making a sandwich?
translation.ko: 안에서 뭐 하는 거야? 샌드위치라도 만드나?

translation.en: Where's her sense of responsibility?
-What? -What?
Hey. What the...?
Funny to run into you, Betsy. I was just strolling the neighborhood.
translation.ko: 이렇게 만나다니 신기하네요 이 동네를 돌아다니던 중인데

translation.en: You were in an accident? Oh, that's....
Come on.
-Yeah. -She took off on us.
-She what? -It was textbook, man.
We were diamonds. But then she just took off.
translation.ko: 우린 완벽했는데 그 여자가 그냥 갔어요

translation.en: Okay, wait. She hit and run?
That's what I'm saying. She bailed and wailed.
Okay, just stay where you are. I'll come get you.
translation.ko: 알았어, 거기 있어 내가 데리러 갈게

translation.en: No, no, no. Screw that, man. We're following her.
You're-- How are--? You're following her how?
We got our ways, yo.
Okay, okay, okay. New plan. New plan.
You do know me. I'm your lawyer. You got that? I'll meet you at the school.
translation.ko: 너희는 날 알아, 내가 너희 변호사야 알았지? 학교에서 보자

translation.en: No, she's way past the school.
She hooked a left on Juan Tabo, now she's coming into Holiday Park.
translation.ko: 후안 타보에서 좌회전해서 홀리데이 파크로 가고 있어요

translation.en: Okay, stay with her. When she gets where she's going...
...wherever that is, don't do anything.
-Wait for me. -Wait for what?
You haven't been right even once. Slippin' Jimmy my ass.
translation.ko: 하나도 맞은 게 없잖아 미끄럼 지미 좋아하네

translation.en: You fell into the honeypot, kid. You get it? Hit-and-run is a felony.
translation.ko: 너 지금 꿀통에 굴러떨어진 거야 알아? 뺑소니는 중죄라고

translation.en: -So what? -"So what?" So more money.
translation.ko: - 그래서요? - 그래서 돈을 더 받을 수 있지

translation.en: He says we fell in the honeypot.
-He says more money. -So, what do we need him for?
translation.ko: - 돈도 더 받는대 - 그럼 그 작자가 왜 필요해?

translation.en: Cal, Lars, whoever--
Oh, damn it.
Come on, come on.
-Do it, do it, do it. -Son of a bitch.
Come on. Come on.
-Hey, your leg. -Oh, I'm gonna do this one.
Okay. Hey. Hey. Yo, hold up.
Hey, yeah, you. What is the matter with you?
-You hit and run. -You ran him over.
You felonied my brother.
-Habla English. -We call-- We call la policia.
translation.ko: - 영어 좀 해 - '라 폴리시아' 부를 거야

translation.en: -La policia gonna be pissed. -I see you hit him.
translation.ko: - '라 폴리시아'가 화낼걸 - 당신이 치는 거 봤어

translation.en: You see that windshield? You did that.
-I did that. -You did that.
-You did that to me. -Now you pay.
Make with the dinero.
Sí, righteous dinero.
-Okay. -Yeah, that's what I'm talking about.
Okay.
Let's go.
-Is that money? -Yeah.
Watch the step. Watch the step.
Watch it. Watch the step.
Where are you?
Holiday Park.
Mrs. Kettleman, Betsy, what are you doing here?
translation.ko: 케틀먼 부인, 벳시 여기서 뭐 하는 거죠?

translation.en: Hit-and-run? That's very serious.
I can mediate. I represent their parents, so....
translation.ko: 제가 중재하죠 얘들 부모가 제 의뢰인이라서...

translation.en: Come on, come on.
Open up, officer of the court.
Open up in the name of the law.
Good afternoon, this--
